intro: Bumelia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered bumelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Bumelia pauciflora is often found in moist, wooded areas and is adapted to thrive in humid, subtropical climates.
